text: Optics	  and	  Waves	  (week	  4)	   Two	  strings	  of	  density	  µ1	  and	  µ2	  are	  joined	  together	  and	  are	  under	  the	  same	   tension.	  An	  incident	  wave	   y1 = A cos(k1x !!t) is	  partially	  transmitted	  and	  partially	   reflected	  at	  the	  point	  where	  the	  strings	  are	  joined.	  The	  transmitted	  and	  reflected	   waves	  are	   yt = B cos(k2x !!t) 	  and	  	   yr = C cos(k1x +!t) ,	  respectively.	  We	  know	   that	   B = 2k1 k1 + k2 A, C = k1 ! k2 k1 + k2 A .	  	   The	  incident	  wave	  has	  energy	   1 2 !2A2µ1"1 	  over	  one	  wavelength.	   Show	  that	  the	  sum	  of	  the	  energy	  carried	  by	  the	  transmitted	  wave	  yt	  and	  that	  by	   the	  reflected	  wave	  yr	  equals	  the	  energy	  from	  the	  initial	  wave	  y1.
